Uses of Class
Cell

    • Uses of Cell in <Unnamed>

      Subclasses of Cell in <Unnamed> 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Acid
      Acid tiles kill a character when they move onto it if they do not have a hazmat suit.
      class  ColouredDoor
      Characters will be stopped from moving onto a Coloured Door tile if it is closed and they do not have a keycard of the correct colour.
      class  Door
      Characters will be stopped from moving onto a Door tile if it is closed and they do not meet the conditions to open it.
      class  Floor
      Characters will collect any Collectables on a floor tile they move on if there is one.
      class  Goal
      Goal tiles will make the character win when they move onto it.
      class  Hazard
      Characters will die if they do not have a specific collectable when moving onto a hazard.
      class  PoweredDoor
      Characters will be stopped from moving onto a Powered Door tile if it is closed and they do not have enough energy to open it.
      class  Teleporter
      Characters will be teleported when they move onto a teleporter tile.
      class  Wall
      Characters and enemies are not allowed to walk onto Wall tiles.
      class  Wires
      Any 'Wires' tile will kill a character when they move onto it if they do not have rubber boots.

      abstract void Enemy.move(Character ch, Cell[][] map)
      This is a move method for the enemies which is responsible for the enemies moving around the map, each enemy will have a different set of movements.
      void WallFollowingEnemy.move(Character ch, Cell[][] map)
      Follows either the left or the right wall all around the map.
      void SmartTargetingEnemy.move(Character ch, Cell[][] gameMap)
      Once this method is called then it runs the path finding algorithm and then if it is not empty then it will remove the first node from it as the first node is the initial location of the enemy.
      void StraightLineEnemy.move(Character ch, Cell[][] map)
      This method moves the enemy by 1 block in either vertical or horizontal direction, if there is a wall or a collectible or a door in front of the enemy, then the enemy will bounce and walk in the opposite direction.
      void DumbTargetingEnemy.move(Character ch, Cell[][] map)
      This move method gets the magnitude of the distance between enemies x and characters x coordinates and compares it to the magnitude of the distance between enemies y and characters y coordinates.
      void SmartTargetingEnemy.randomMove(Cell[][] gameMap)
      If the enemy didn't find a path to the character then it will move randomly.
